title: Topics in Chinese Philosophy
description: A study of one or more highly influential figures from Chinese philosophy, such as Confucius, Mozi, Mencius, Laozi, Zhuangzi, Xunzi, Han Feizi, and later Chinese thinkers. The focus may be on particular texts or intellectual themes and traditions. May be taken for credit up to two times. Prerequisites: upper-division standing or consent of instructor.
